intro: Gomesa unicolor, commonly known as the single-colored gomesa, is a species of flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically range in color from white to pale yellow. Its leaves are usually opposite, ovate, and have a smooth texture. Gomesa unicolor is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
